summary: DynDOLOD is a set of simple tools based on xEdit and xLODGen to automatically create a Skyrim mod based on the load order which adds distant LOD for objects to Skyrim. By combining DynDOLOD with xLODGen users can create drastically enhanced traditional static LOD plus tree LOD and the new, optional dynamic distant object LOD in a few simple steps.
descriptionHtml:
You know the price for my mods: blood, sweat and tears. Oh, and your first born.
If you want to help other authors of quality mods then support them directly.

[url=http://forum.step-project.com/topic/13029-dyndolod-237-skyrim-sevr-beta/]Skyrim SE and Skyrim VR beta[/url] for experienced users. See the included docs\DynDOLOD_Manual_SSE.html andÂ docs\DynDOLOD_Manual_TES5VR.html

[size=6][b]Check the including manual and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59721/?tab=4&&navtag=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D59721%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D2260939&pUp=1]FAQ[/url] first, then go to [url=http://forum.step-project.com/forum/101-shesons-dyndolod-support/]S.T.E.P. Forums[/url] to discuss and for help or feedback[/b][/size]

[youtube]RXgCDYRDA-k[/youtube] [youtube]TtVfn4DPN-s[/youtube]

Dynamic Distant Objects LOD (DynDOLOD) is a set of simple tools based on xEdit and xLODGen to automatically create a Skyrim mod based on the load order, which adds distant LOD for objects to Skyrim. By combining DynDOLOD with xLODGen users can create drastically enhanced traditional static object LOD plus tree LOD and a new, optional [b]dyn[/b]amic [b]d[/b]istant [b]o[/b]bject [b]LOD[/b] in a few simple steps.

DynDOLOD is meant for enthusiast modders who are familiar with using tools like xEdit. Enthusiast modders have a general knowledge of computers, folders and files, especially Skyrims 'Data' folders and how to install mods safely with a manager or manually. Enthusiast modders can read manuals and FAQs, can post questions on a forum where they get qualified support from the creators of the tools, use the memory patch build into SKSE, verified it works with memory blocks log and already submitted their firstborn.

To fully expand the visual experience and use the additional features offered by xLODGen, the DynDOLOD package comes with over 4500 updated or new LOD models for objects that were badly missing from the original game like the Skyhaven Temple or landscape features like roads, smaller rocks and dirt cliffs that simply make the distant landscape look much more natural and alive.

DynDOLOD combines generating tree LOD and object LOD into one process. Tree LOD generation is exactly the same as with TES5LODGen. It is started automatically from within the DynDOLOD process. Please [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62698/]check the TES5LODGen pages[/url] for how to successfully generate tree LOD for the load order.

DynDOLOD offers a plethora of settings and options, the visual result and performance impact is fully at the hands of the enthusiast modder. There is already a wealth of information how to fine tune every aspect in the included documents. Yes, that means if the game runs worse after using this you doing it wrong :p

[size=6]Step-by-step tutorial from GamerPoets for MO/NMM[/size]
[youtube]1_5MWqeHIzw[/youtube] [youtube]MFsIbCJWH_c[/youtube]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF1Qkw7OUG4JmIrw1QI-oWg]See GamerPoets channel for more great tutorials[/url]. Please consider supporting GamerPoets through [url=http://goo.gl/oTXR6P]PayPal[/url] or [url=http://goo.gl/gF9Scn]Patreon[/url] if you find the instructional videos useful.

[size=6]Requirements[/size]
[list][*][b][size=3][url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url][/size][/b][/*]
[*][b][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58705/]PapyrusUtil 2.8 [/url][/size][/b] or higher[/*]
[*][b]DynDOLOD Resources[/b] - Make sure to use DynDOLOD Resources version only with matching or higher DynDOLOD Standalone versions but never with older versions.
[*]Vanilla Skyrim LOD Billboards from [b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62698/]TES5LODGen[/url][/b] or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75269/]Indistinguishable Vanilla Tree Billboards[/url]. Then overwrite with any optional LOD Billboards for the load order[/*]
[/list]

[size=6]Installation[/size]
[list][*]Install the Core Files from DynDOLOD Resources, which contain the folders 'interface', 'meshes', 'textures' and 'scripts' into Skyrims 'Data' folder. Typically overwrite any files or refer to the Manual - Overwrite Orders. Install other options from DynDOLOD Resources as desired.[/*]
[*]Install Vanilla Skyrim LOD Billboards from TES5LODGen or Indistinguishable Vanilla Tree Billboards and let them overwrite any DynDOLOD Resources files. Then overwrite with any LOD Billboards for mods in the the load order. For STEP users all billboards are included in STEP Texture Compilation.[/*]
[*]Depending on the load order, install patches from DynDOLOD Patches. See Manual - Compatibility - Some Assembly Required if a patch is required.[/*]
[*]From the DynDOLOD Standalone archive copy the content of the 'DynDOLOD' folder which contains the files DynDOLOD.exe, TexGen.exe, DynDOLOD_QuickStart.html and the sub folders 'Docs' and 'Edit Scripts' with all their content into a new 'DynDOLOD' folder outside of the game folders and Mod Organizers virtual file structure. Do not mix with old versions or xEdit installation.[/*]
[*]If a texture replacer is used, consider updating LOD textures with TexGen.exe for the load order before running DynDOLOD.exe. It is a simple tool that generates some LOD textures based on the full textures of the current load order. This process is limited and requires Dragonborn and Dawnguard to be installed.[/*]
[/list]

[size=6]Generate LOD[/size]
[youtube]90TRMvFdduo[/youtube] [youtube]1BUAVP9ZPf8[/youtube]

[list][*]If starting from scratch, remove all former generated output from the load order including DynDOLOD.esp - a new one will be created. If updating, keep the existing DynDOLOD.esp last in the load order.[/*]
[*]Start DynDOLOD.exe. It will load the current load order, so add or remove mods as needed with the mod manager.[/*]
[/list]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/59721-0-1466778892.png[/img]

[list][*]Wait for the the patcher to boot up and show the RTFM window. Wait until the OK button becomes available. Click OK.[/*]
[*]Once the wizard options window is displayed, select worlds.[/*]
[*]Select an output path. The output path should be outside of the game folders and Mod Organizers virtual file structure.[/*]
[*]Start generating tree and object LOD by clicking on either 'Low', 'Medium' or 'High' button.[/*]
[*]After generation completed with the message 'DynDOLOD Worlds completed successfully', close DynDOLOD.exe and save the newly created DynDOLOD.esp.[/*]
[*]Copy/move generated files from output path including 'DynDOLOD.esp' and the folders 'meshes', 'skse' and 'textures' to Skyrim 'Data' directory. If updating an existing DynDOLOD.esp overwrite all older files. If using a mod manager compress the files into an archive and install the archive as a mod as shown in the videos.[/*]
[*]Activate DynDOLOD.esp. Ignore any contradicting third party instructions from people that obviously did not RTFM.[/*]
[*]Start a new game or load a save game and enter the worldspace. Wait for onscreen message top left and/or check MCM menu.[/*]
[/list]

[heading][/heading]

"Yeah it was ridiculously easy. I don't understand why everyone makes it out to be fucking rocket science." - [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/comments/3b8lkx/dyndolod_is_amazing/cskobyf]Elianora[/url]

"... it requires installing dozens or even hundreds of texture/mesh mods to improve 60% of what you see, and only a single mod to improve 40%. This is a no brainer." - [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/comments/4mr1ax/if_you_havent_used_dyndolod_during_a/d3xty56]zilav[/url]

"Skyrims LODs still suck veiny c*ck" - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XZ_Hv_O2qg8&t=258]MxR[/url]

"I hate Skyrim LODs" - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b93KN9RgwAc&t=537]MxR

[/url]"You guys know how I always complain about the LODs" - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6_75imNBdk&t=503]MxR[/url] has been complaining for years and still believes covering up the LODs is "fixing that shit" - just use DynDOLOD to fix that shit for real, dude.

[heading]Compatibility[/heading]
Any Mod with pre-generated LOD and instructions to overwrite the LOD generated by DynDOLOD.exe for the current load order is always wrong and incompatible and should be removed.

Instead acquire and install the LOD resources to generate compatible LOD for the current LOD order.

If billboards that were used for pre-made tree LOD are not available, split the tree LOD atlas as explained in the included manual or watch [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MFsIbCJWH_c&vq=hd1080&t=493]Tree LOD Billboard Creation : Start to Finish

[/url]Ignore any instructions or comments made by anyone who has never used DynDOLOD or did not bother to read the included manuals.

[heading]Compatibility - Out With The Old, In With The New[/heading]
Mods listed here are replaced by DynDOLOD. They should be removed from the load order.

Skyrim Distant Overhaul - SDO - both the static object LOD *.bto and all *.esps.
Expand Object LODs
Skyrim Distant Detail and Distant Detail Hearthfire Edition

[heading]Compatibility - Mods Requiring DynDOLOD[/heading]
Mods listed here were created specifically with LOD generation in mind. They usually work right out of the box.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68782/]Enhanced Landscapes[/url] - Includes billboards and LOD textures that need to overwrite vanilla billboards and DynDOLOD Resources - Core Files textures. If LOD textures are generated with TexGen.exe, they should always overwrite everything else. Watch [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3npzxXLWIwA]2016 Skyrim Modding Guide Ep19 - Enhanced Landscapes and DynDOLOD[/url] video.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81088/]Enhanced Landscapes - Winter Edition[/url] - Includes billboards and LOD textures that need to overwrite vanilla billboards and DynDOLOD Resources - Core Files textures. If LOD textures are generated with TexGen.exe, they should always overwrite everything else.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76931/]HD-LOD Buildings[/url] - Overwrite any textures from DynDOLOD Resources but not TexGen output (future proof advise). and adjust Max tile size on advanced options to match the downloaded resolution or use it to shrink higher resolution back down to lower resolution automatically while the atlas is created.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75269/]Indistinguishable Vanilla Tree Billboards[/url] - Alternative which replaces Vanilla + DLC tree LOD billboards from TES5LODGen

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68363/]Mountains Enhanced[/url]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65882/]Regional Snow and Ice[/url] [size=1]2[/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75856/]Spice of Life - Forts[/url] [size=1]2[/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79397/]Spice of Life - Orc Strongholds[/url] [size=1]2[/size] - Includes LOD meshes that need to overwrite DynDOLOD Resources - Core Files meshes.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81565/]Winter Aspen Billboards[/url]

1) Custom mesh rules included in DynDOLOD. Rules for this mod are added to the mesh rules list automatically if needed when using the 'Default', 'Low', 'Medium' or 'High' buttons.

2) Contains new/updated LOD assets or defines full models as static LOD. New/updated LOD assets or full models defined as static LOD are used automatically.

3) For performance reasons some or all new objects added by this mod are ignored because they are hidden from view behind town walls.

4) A select list of objects added by this mod have LOD.

5) The mod needs to be [url=http://www.creationkit.com/TES5Edit_Cleaning_Guide_-_TES5Edit]cleaned[/url]

[heading]DynDOLOD includes LOD assets based on models and/or textures from[/heading]
[list]

[/list]

[heading]Additional Permission Notes[/heading]

Everything in the DynDOLOD package is free to use, so if anything from DynDOLOD like scripts, meshes, textures, generated LOD, modified or not, is used in mods or as resources for mods it should be free as well.

If LOD generated by DynDOLOD is used in the game, you are required to make good looking videos and screenshots and upload them to the
Internet. As long as access to the good looking videos and screenshots is available for free and public consumption, they can be monetized and content/media creators can be compensated for their work.

Crediting DynDOLOD or Sheson is the right thing to do and appreciated.

CC BY-NC-SA

files.name: DynDOLOD Resources
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - warn about and try to ignore wild edits causing out of place objects near cell 0, 0 in Tamriel
DynDOLOD.exe - warn if a deleted reference is found
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes not discovering new cells added by plugins
DynDOLOD.exe - do not convert persistent neverfades if temporary cell does not exist
DynDOLOD.exe - updated exporting data for destructables
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed not reading other txt or ini files from BSA
DynDOLOD.exe - generate new esp version for updated Papyrus Scripts
DynDOLOD.exe - added worldspace ignore file to filter world space drop down
DynDOLOD.exe - optimized fallback to full tree model
TexGen.exe - added generation for volcanictundrarocks01.dds
TexGen.exe - fixed not reading other txt or ini files from BSA
DynDOLOD_Manual.html - updated compatibility information for several mods
DynDOLOD_Manual_SSE.html - added info for a mod
DynDOLOD-Trees.html - added info for a mod
DynDOLOD Resources - Optimized Papyrus Scripts - requires new LOD generation from scratch and clean save cycle
DynDOLOD Resources - Papyrus Scripts - fixed a multi threading race condition
DynDOLOD Resources - updated/added meshes/textures for better compatibility with mods
DynDOLOD Resources SE - updated/added meshes/textures for better compatibility with mods
LODGen.exe - fixed a reading error for bhkMoppBvTreeShape
LODGen.exe - fixed a reading error for bhkRigidBody
LODGen.exe - improved material wilcard * support
LODGen.exe - added option to FlatTextures= file to alternatively define a path to nif instead of path to normals file
LODGen.exe - added export Mode=convertsse and Mode=convertfo4 to atlas the UV of meshes
LODGen.exe - normalize material path
LODGen.exe - support material swaps with wildcard *
LODGen.exe - added DefaultAlphaThreshold=0-255 for FO4
LODGen.exe - added mergeVertexColors[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=true/false to average different vertex colors of duplicate vertices into one vertex (requires RemoveUnseenFaces)
LODGen.exe - always apply intermediate atlas before applying final atlas
LODGen.exe - added notTangentsMeshMask[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=[part of nif filename]
LODGen.exe - updated supporting libraries to latest version
LODGen.exe - added notLODFlagMeshMask[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=[part of nif filename]
LODGen.exe - added generateVertexColors[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=true/false
LODGen.exe - added generateTangents[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=true/false
LODGen.exe - added fixTangents[LOD4|LOD8|LOD16|LOD32]=true/false

files.name: DynDOLOD Standalone
files.changelogHtml: DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes not using data from txt for billboards in object LOD

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - added beta support for TES5VR, start with -TES5VR command line argument, uses SSE config files and settings
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes not creating a flat atlas
DynDOLOD.exe - improved replacement textures handling for object and dynamic LOD
DynDOLOD.exe - added patching function for plugins + worldspace
DynDOLOD Resources SE - updated/added meshes for better compatibility with mods
DynDOLOD Resources SE - Papyrus Scripts - added cell attach/trigger counters
DynDOLOD_Manual.html - updated compatibility information for several mods
DynDOLOD_Manual_SEE.html - updated compatibility information for several mods
DynDOLOD_Manual_TES5VR.html - added with brief explanations what is different to the Skyrim SE version
TexGen.exe - added beta support for TES5VR, start with -TES5VR command line argument, uses SSE config files and settings
TexGen.exe - added generation for fallforestdirt01.dds, reachdirt01.dds, road01fallforest01.dds and road01reach01.dds
LODGen.exe - fixed terrain water segments for odd origins
LODGen.exe - added WaterHeight= default water z, used in case of missing cell data
LODGen.exe - print global alpha threshold setting to log
LODGen.exe - catch an error in nif and print its name to log

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed not using -o command line
DynDOLOD.exe - improve loading of paid mod plugins
DynDOLOD.exe - create ESM at correct load order
DynDOLOD.exe - improved error message when trying to add wrong base record of wrong type
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes not finding new base records resulting in no model error for dynamic LOD
DynDOLOD.exe - print plugin type when listing plugins
DynDOLOD Resources SE - Papyrus Scripts - reworked plugin detection

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - improved some error messages
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes injecting worldspaces instead adding them as overwrites
LODGen.exe - changed requirements to MS Visual C++ 2017 Redistributable (2015 should still work, as they are supposed to be binary compatible)
LODGen.exe - changed Redistributable missing message to link to https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads
LODGen.exe - removed obsolete embedded resources

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes not creating a dedicated dynamic LOD base record with correct overwrites
DynDOLOD.exe - do not add Quest with SKSE/PapyrusUtil checks to plugin in case dynamic LOD is not generated

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed a pointer conversion error
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed sometimes adding ESP masters to DynDOLOD.esm
DynDOLOD.exe - added creation of bugreport.txt in case of exception
DynDOLOD Resources SE - Papyrus Scripts - reworked plugin detection
DynDOLOD Resources SE - added patches for better compatibility with mods
LODGen.exe - fixed LOD water for FO3/FNV to use seperate shapes in correct order for different heights
LODGen.exe - fixed passthru meshes sometimes not keeping their large reference status

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - fixed using misplaced patches for different game mode
DynDOLOD.exe - improved export of miniatlas data for LODGen.exe
DynDOLOD.exe - improved some error messages
TexGen.exe - added generation for shipwoodfloor01lod.dds
LODGen.exe - skip automatic re-UV for shapes with a high number of triangles
LODGen.exe - fixed sometimes scaling water level twice for undefined cells
LODGen.exe - added support for FO3/FNV placed water references for terrain LOD meshes

files.name: DynDOLOD
files.changelogHtml:
DynDOLOD.exe - refined bounds calculations for what counts as a large reference
DynDOLOD Resources SE - updated/added meshes/textures for better compatibility with mods
LODGen.exe - reworked simplification of meshes after re-UV
LODGen.exe - added a sanity check after re-UV
LODGen.exe - fixed a scaling error when applying miniatlas
